author: Pam S
title: Forum Post: My First
text:
December 31, 2023 at 10:49 AM
By Pam S
Pam S
December weather in Michigan has been awesome, that is for Michigan weather standards. Got a number of rounds in for the month. Played yesterday (12/30/2023) with three guys. We were partnered and playing best ball match play. On #16, my partner dumped his shot into the water, the only water hole on the course. Feeling a slight bit of pressure, I took out my driver and my ball landed on the green. It was about a 155 yard drive from the #4 tees. My first thought was hoping to make a birdie putt so we could win the hole. The four of us were talking as we approached the green and as I started looking for my ball, I couldn't see it on the green. I thought, "oh great, it rolled off into the rough." Then one of the guys said, "I think it went into the hole!" And.....sure enough.....there it was in the hole.
The course was Traverse City Golf and Country Club. Probably the only hole-in-one on the course in December. Of course, not many rounds are played in December in Traverse City.

author: Conchi García
title: La Aemet eleva a naranja el aviso por calor este viernes en Málaga
text: La ola de calor remite en España este viernes, pero no así en Málaga, que espera otro de los peores días de la semana a causa del terral. \"Málaga va por libre\", señala el delegado territorial de la Aemet en Andalucía, Juan de Dios del Pino. Por eso, mientras que las alertas se van aliviando en la región y el país, la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología mantiene para este viernes el riesgo en gran parte de la provincia malagueña, y ha elevado a naranja el aviso por altas temperaturas para la Costa del Sol Occidental, la Axarquía y el Valle del Guadalhorce. Ya se nota el viento asfixiante. El aviso naranja (riesgo importante) se mantendrá entre las 13:00 y las 21:00 horas, por temperaturas de 39 grados que en el interior de las comarcas afectadas pueden superar los 40. En el interior de la provincia, Ronda y Antequera, sí se espera que las máximas desciendan algo hasta los 34 y 36 grados, respectivamente. En cambio, en todo litoral y en el Valle del Guadalhorce el terral volverá a empujar al mercurio hacia arriba, aunque la previsión detallada de las temperaturas que hace la Aemet no indica que se vayan a superar las máximas de ayer jueves, cuando Álora rozó los 45 grados. En concreto, esta localidad registró 44,3 grados a las 16:40 horas, la temperatura más elevada de toda España. Cerca se quedó Coín (43,1), otro de los municipios en los que mejor saben cómo de insportable puede llegar a ser el terral malagueño. También por encima de los 40 grados pasaron la tarde del jueves los vecinos de Alpandeire, en la Serranía de Ronda, donde se llegó a los 41,4, mientras que en Estepona los termómetros marcaron 40,7 grados, muy similar a lo ocurrido en Cortes de la Frontera, con 40,4. Una madrugada sofocante Si la tarde fue sofocante, la noche no lo ha sido menos. La provincia ha firmado una madrugada histórica de calor. A las 02:00 horas Málaga capital marcaba 34,6 grados, registrados en el termómetro del aeropuerto, el que la Aemet toma como referencia para establecer sus registros oficiles. Desde 1942, año en que comenzaron a tomarse datos, la ciudad no había vivido una madrugada tan cálida. Ese fue el pico de calor de la noche, pero la temperatura mínima nocturna también ha sido una de las más altas de los últimos 75 años: 30,2 grados. Apenas un grado por detrás del verano pasado, que atesora las dos mínimas históricas registradas por la Aemet (31,6 grados el 20 de julio; y 30,3 grados el 2 de agosto).

author: @UnioneSarda
title: Servizio farmaci al “Casula”, da gennaio si prenota su internet - L'Unione Sarda.it
text:
L’anno nuovo porta miglioramenti nel servizio di farmacia del Policlinico “Duilio Casula” di Monserrato, dov’è in funzione il servizio di distribuzione diretta dei medicinali ai pazienti non ricoverati. Le modifiche, chiariscono dalla direzione dell’Azienda ospedaliero universitaria di Monserrato, hanno l’obiettivo di migliorare la qualità del servizio.
La novità è semplice, in questo cambio delle modalità di distribuzione. Dal 2 gennaio sarà richiesta la prenotazione, che potrà essere richiesta facilmente, con pochi clic, nella piattaforma web che è stata creata. La si trova all’indirizzo https://bit.ly/3LoQx0i oppure inquadrando con lo smartphone il codice Qr nell’articolo dedicato a questo servizio che si trova nella homepage del sito www.aoucagliari,it. Dopo l’ingresso nel sistema, si potranno scegliere data e ora del ritiro dei farmaci, indicando anche nome e cognome del paziente assistito, mail e un recapito telefonico.
I farmaci potranno essere ritirati il martedì e il giovedì sia la mattina (dalle 9.30 alle 12.30) sia il pomeriggio (dalle 14 alle 18) e il mercoledì pomeriggio (dalle 14 alle 18). La prenotazione non è richiesta per il ritiro del farmaco da dimissione ospedaliera o da visita specialistica.
RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA
Questo contenuto è riservato agli utenti abbonati Per continuare a leggere abbonati o effettua l'accesso se sei già abbonato.

author: ebb tide
title: [Catholic Caucus] The Church's Dysfunctional Culture of "Respect and Obedience"
text:
Subservience is ever ancient, ever new. In that respect, the hierarchy of the Church is not much different than the hierarchies of business and government. But servile obedience can foster a culture of self-destructive tyranny even within the institutional Church.
By God’s design, the Church is a hierarchy, not a democracy. The successor of Saint Peter is at the top of the pyramid – or, from another point of view, at the bottom of an inverted pyramid. The office of the papacy identifies the pope as the “servant of the servants.” The pope rules the entire Church and enjoys, by divine institution, the “supreme, full, immediate, and universal power in the care of souls.” (CCC 937)
The bishops are the successors of the twelve apostles. Jesus, through His Church, confers authority on the bishops (by the “laying on of the hands”) as “priests, prophets, and kings.” Their role is conservative – in the proper, non-political sense. They are dutybound to conserve, proclaim, and hand on the apostolic truths. They abide by the truths of Sacred Tradition – G.K. Chesterton’s “democracy of the dead.”
The authority of a priest is inextricably bound to the authority of his lawful bishop (or sometimes through a religious superior). During ordination, a priest solemnly promises to respect and obey his bishop and his successors. Bishops are also bound in obedience to the Deposit of Faith.
Church bureaucracies cannot substitute for the inherent religious authority of bishops and priests. A parish council is advisory and has no authority over the pastor. The United States Conference of Catholic Bishops (USCCB) has its delegated administrative duties but does not have doctrinal authority over individual bishops. USCCB policy positions do not carry authoritative doctrinal weight unless individual bishops ratify the statements as their own. Even then, the faithful have a right to distinguish between the principles of Catholic doctrine and the prudential judgments of the bishop.
A bishop or a pope may have varying opinions on, say, immigration policy. The first principles of the faith bind in conscience. We insist upon the inestimable dignity of every human being and the tenets of the Decalogue. Summary execution of illegal immigrants – to take an outlandish example that no one has suggested – would clearly be immoral. A country has a right, however, to secure borders and the rule of law. Furthermore, violating immigration laws may be an infraction against the secular law, but not necessarily a violation of God’s law.
Breaking the traffic speed limit is not immoral under two conditions (according to traditional moral manuals): 1) We are not acting unsafely, and 2) we pay the traffic fine – if we’re stopped for speeding. Thus, at a minimum, persons who illegally enter the country for economic or political reasons, but must abide by the just laws of the host country.
The right to protect a nation’s (and a family’s) sovereignty with appropriate border control is always open to debate over particulars. The prudential application of Catholic moral principles by the clergy in matters beyond their competence does not bind in conscience, and often tramples on the rights of the laity.
In a recent letter to the American bishops, Pope Francis said deporting people who fled “extreme poverty, insecurity, exploitation, persecution or serious environmental deterioration in their home nations,” regardless of how they enter the U.S., “damages the dignity of many men and women, and of entire families, and places them in a state of particular vulnerability and defenselessness.”
Archbishop Timothy Broglio, President of the USCCB, unsurprisingly thanked the Holy Father for his encouragement to continue the pastoral work of the American bishops for those most in need. His letter, however, did not much endorse what seem to be the pope’s policy judgments.
The Trump administration’s “border czar,” Tom Homan, has not received the papal opprobrium like an obedient schoolboy. A veteran of decades of fighting the cartels and the traffickers, he reclaimed the political turf that belongs to the laity: “I’ve got harsh words for the pope: I say this as a lifelong Catholic. He ought to focus on his work and leave enforcement to us. He’s got a wall around the Vatican, does he not?”
Christian first principles – the dignity of the human person and the Commandments – intersect. But the overlap – unlike the politics of direct abortion – is partial and open to debate. If we clearly distinguish between our proper religious and political roles, we should expect robust disagreement in prudential judgements.
The clergy must protect consciences. If Tom Homan or any other American lined up for Confession, the priest should be able to offer the same advice to both of them. Apply the eternal Christian principles enunciated by the Church to the best of your abilities with God’s love. Ignore the ecclesiastical trespassing.
Church officials usually have a certain handicap: the overextension of that promise of “respect and obedience” to the pope and the bishops. Ordinary priests usually remain meekly silent in the face of the absurdities of their bishops.
Recently, an American bishop placed his miter on the head of a young girl in front of the altar, presumably to the delight of the congregation. Many priests in private took the bishop to task for this cavalier gesture involving his sacred office. But it’s unlikely any priest dared to speak to the bishop. Such criticism would not violate the promise of “respect and obedience,’ but it would risk bureaucratic retribution.
The dysfunctional culture of disordered “respect and obedience” within the institutional Church is effeminate. Priests rarely speak to their superiors with manly honesty but gossip like schoolgirls behind their backs. Some bishops penalize honesty more than ecclesiastical misdemeanors and crimes. How else can we explain the decades of episcopal dereliction of duty in the child-abuse scandals?
Tom Homan’s gruff honesty is refreshing because he both respects Church authority and recognizes its limits. Priests and laity alike could learn from him: Stay in your lane. We could use honest pushback by priests and bishops when Church authorities trespass on the rights of the laity.

author: Jason Donald
title: PM denies Budget forecasts ‘fantasy’
text: By NEIL HARTNELL Tribune Business Editor nhartnell@tribunemedia.net The Prime Minister yesterday denied that the Government’s Budget forecasts are “fantasy” as he asserted that recent monthly fiscal deficits for June were elevated due to paying off outstanding bills. Philip Davis KC, leading off the House of Assembly’s Budget debate, admitted that achieving the 2023-2024 full-year deficit target of around $210m will require “a heightened degree of expenditure constraint” over the next few weeks to month’s end to either balance the books or generate a modest surplus. Hitting back at the Opposition and other critics, who have argued that the full-year deficit forecast is highly unlikely to be met, he said: “I have taken a hands-on approach to this Budget and have ensured that it was a collaborative effort across the entirety of government. That is, across every ministry, agency and department in support of the Ministry of Finance’s meetings with ministers, permanent secretaries and heads of public corporations. This has led to better accountability and a more comprehensive and accurate Budget. So we did not arbitrarily come up with figures. Extensive work has been done to ensure that our projections reflect reliable and accountable figures.” Acknowledging that the Government still has “a lot of work to do to rebuild the fiscal buffers” so that The Bahamas has the financial headroom to cope with climate change and further devastating hurricanes, he added: “We have projected a deficit of 1 percent to 1.5 percent based on the expenditure and revenue performance up to April 2024. “I will admit, however, that achieving this target has required a heightened degree of expenditure constraint and focus on revenue collection. However, as we have demonstrated over the last three years, our fiscal plans are based on reality, not fantasy. “In addition, it should be noted that the fourth quarter deficit experienced in the last two years was the result of deliberate policy decisions to eliminate, as much as possible, the arrears for vendor payments left by the previous administration. I am happy to report that, as the arrears report in the mid-year Budget presentation has demonstrated, this policy has succeeded and we have substantially reduced vendor arrears.” The Government, in its Fiscal Strategy Report, said it had reduced payment arrears owed to vendors to a sum equal to 2.1 percent of nominal gross domestic product (GDP) at year-end 2023 as opposed to 3.7 percent the year before. However, there is evidence that major monthly deficits towards the end of the Government’s fiscal year - typically May and June - are a structural issue rather than a temporary problem caused by accelerated payment of outstanding bills as suggested by the Prime Minister. Santander, the major global financial institution, last week became the latest to add its voice to those arguing that the Government still has much work to do to hit its $210m deficit target for the current 2023-2024 fiscal year. While the Davis administration must maintain a balanced Budget, or slight surplus, during the three months to end-June to reach this goal, the bank noted that such an outcome will fly in the face of past experience. Pointing out that June alone has generated an average $180m monthly deficit for the past decade, Santander warned that “there will be less tolerance on [any] fiscal slippage” during the current fiscal year due to the revised 2024-2025 surplus target. For the past two fiscal years, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023, the Government has sustained deficits totalling $353.5m and $293.7m, respectively, for the fourth quarter as a result of government ministries, departments and agencies racing to bring forth bills that the Ministry of Finance knew nothing about so that they can be paid and cleared before the fiscal year-end. Meanwhile, reaffirming his administration’s plan to crack down on suspected VAT avoidance on high-end real estate deals worth more than $1m, Mr Davis said: “Another peculiar feature of this tax is that most of the revenue is collected on purchases by Bahamian companies owned by non-Bahamians. This has always been a feature of the tax, either with the current structure of VAT or the previous structure of Stamp tax. This has only increased with the repeal of the Immovable Properties Act. The very nature of the tax, be it Stamp Tax or VAT on real estate, makes it susceptible to abuse. “Over the last two years, as a tax authority, the Department of Inland Revenue detected some unusual activity in this tax. Unusual in that significant real estate transactions, although announced by realtors, were not immediately followed by the presentation of conveyances for stamping.” Mr Davis said the tax authorities have also detected an increase in the use of “inter vivos” transfers of real estate, meaning properties have been gifted to other family members, to trusts “and other exotic structures”. “Inter vivos transfers or deeds of gifts have legitimate estate planning purposes, although their uses in The Bahamas are limited because we have no estate taxes,” he added. “So limiting inter vivos transfers to natural persons does not impede the estate planning ability of any real estate owner.” Turning to other revenue measures, Mr Davis said long-term residential rentals will again be exempt from VAT because its implementation was hurting tenants. “In order to prevent a clear tax avoidance strategy currently being employed by foreigner owners of property, we are clarifying in the Real Property Tax Act that, despite a life tenant of a property being a Bahamian, the property will not be considered Bahamian-owned if the beneficiaries are not Bahamian,” he added. “The real property tax should be paid by the foreign owner despite a Bahamian being designated as a life tenant. The Bahamian living there will not be required to pay the tax, but only the foreign owner.” Comments Use the comment form below to begin a discussion about this content.

title: 舟山海警查获非法捕捞案 禁渔期首案告破_新闻频道_中华网
text:
近日，舟山海警局查获了今年浙江海域禁渔期首起非法捕捞案，现场查获近3000斤梭子蟹，案值约30万元。
自5月1日12时起，东海海域全面进入禁渔期。然而，仍有不法分子抱有侥幸心理，顶风作案。5月3日21时许，浙江舟山海警局接到群众报警，称岱山海域有一船只形迹可疑，疑似正在进行非法捕捞作业。经过分析研判，该局立即派遣附近执法艇进行查缉。
锁定目标船只后，执法员立即亮明身份并进行登临检查。经查，嫌疑船只船舱内装满了新鲜捕捞的梭子蟹，共计约3000斤。初步调查显示，这批梭子蟹是在5月1日至2日期间捕捞所得，涉嫌在禁渔期内非法捕捞水产品。
目前，涉案船舶和渔获物已被依法扣押，涉案人员被带回海警机构接受进一步调查。浙江海警局提醒，在禁渔期内，任何单位和个人不得从事非法捕捞作业。海警机构将加大打击力度，加强海域管控，严厉打击非法捕捞行为，切实保护海洋渔业资源，为海洋生态健康发展保驾护航。

author: AFP
title: Pérou: vaste incendie dans le centre historique de Lima
text:
Back to top
Vue aérienne des pompiers péruviens luttant contre l'incendie d'un hangar de jouets, dans le centre de Lima, le 04 mars 2025
Plusieurs centaines de pompiers luttent depuis lundi contre un vaste incendie dans le centre historique de Lima, qui a déjà touché plusieurs bâtiments commerciaux sans faire de blessés pour le moment, ont indiqué mercredi les autorités.
Le feu s'est déclaré lundi soir dans un entrepôt de jouets et de produits alimentaires, avant de se propager à d'autres bâtiments, a indiqué à la chaîne N Carlos Malpica, un responsable des pompiers.
"L'incendie pourrait se poursuivre jusqu'à dimanche", a-t-il estimé.
Plusieurs habitants ont été contraints de quitter leur logement, certains emportant leur matelas, leur frigidaire ou des chaises.
Une épaisse fumée noire était visible à plusieurs kilomètres du sinistre.
Des pompiers luttent contre un vaste incendie dans le centre historique de Lima, le 4 mars 2025
"Nous sommes dans le centre historique de Lima, où il y a beaucoup d'entrepôts. C'est une véritable bombe à retardement pour les habitations", a témoigné auprès de l'AFPTV Zulli Cabanillas, un habitant du quartier qui a dû quitter son logement.
Mario Casaretto, en charge de la gestion du sinistre pour la municipalité, a fait état lors d'une conférence de presse de "onze familles sinistrées".
M. Malpica a affirmé que les bâtiments touchés ne respectaient "aucune norme". Outre l'absence d'escalier de secours, ils ne disposent pas de système anti-incendie, a-t-il souligné.
Parmi les rares bouches d'incendie certaines sont "hors d'usage", a-t-il déploré.
Plusieurs réservoirs d'eau alimentés par des camions-citernes ont été déployés dans la zone sinistrée.

author: Aitor Ruiz
title: Diez errores que cometes al lavarte el pelo y que debes evitar
text:
El cuidado del cabello es un aspecto que preocupa a muchas personas, ya que una melena mal cuidada puede afectar nuestro estado de ánimo y autoestima. A menudo, atribuimos la culpa de la mala salud de nuestro pelo a productos de baja calidad o herramientas inadecuadas, si bien no siempre tiene que ver.
No obstante, la realidad es bien distinta, puesto que muchos de los problemas capilares provienen de errores cometidos en nuestras rutinas de lavado y en las cuáles no nos fijamos.
Diez errores que cometes al lavarte el pelo
A continuación, echamos un vistazo a los errores más comunes que cometemos al lavar nuestro pelo y qué alternativas podemos tomar para lograr un cabello saludable y radiante.
No desenredar antes del lavado
Uno de los errores más frecuentes es no desenredar el cabello antes de lavarlo. Muchas personas creen que el agua soluciona automáticamente los enredos, pero esto puede causar más daño durante el lavado.
Se recomienda dedicar unos minutos a soltar el pelo con un peine o cepillo antes de entrar a la ducha para facilitar el lavado y minimizar el riesgo de daños.
Usar agua muy caliente
La temperatura del agua es importante para la salud del cabello. Usar agua caliente puede eliminar los aceites naturales del cuero cabelludo, lo que resulta en un cabello seco y dañado.
Para evitarlo, se sugiere utilizar agua tibia o fresca durante el lavado. Esto ayudará a mantener la hidratación natural del cabello y mejorará su apariencia.
No hacer un masaje capilar adecuado
Muchas personas no dedican tiempo suficiente a masajear el cuero cabelludo durante el lavado, lo que es fundamental para una limpieza efectiva. Frotar con fuerza puede dañar la cutícula del cabello.
En su lugar, es preferible un masaje suave con las yemas de los dedos mientras se aplica el champú. Esto limpia y estimula la circulación sanguínea en el cuero cabelludo.
Uso inadecuado del acondicionador
El acondicionador es esencial para mantener el cabello hidratado, pero su aplicación incorrecta puede ser contraproducente. Es un error aplicar el acondicionador en la raíz, ya que esto puede aumentar la grasa en el cabello.
En cambio, se debe aplicar en las puntas y dejar actuar de 3 a 5 minutos para obtener los mejores resultados.
No aclarar con agua fría
El aclarado final con agua fría es fundamental para sellar las cutículas del cabello, lo que resulta en un cabello más suave y brillante. Aunque puede resultar incómodo en invierno, esta práctica es esencial para mantener la salud capilar.
Dejar el cabello mojado por mucho tiempo
Dejar que el cabello se seque al aire después de la ducha puede parecer una buena idea, pero prolongar este proceso puede ser perjudicial. La humedad excesiva puede dañar el cabello y aumentar el riesgo de rotura.
Se recomienda secar suavemente el cabello con una toalla y evitar irse a la cama con el cabello mojado.
Lavar el cabello todos los días
Es un error común lavar el cabello a diario, ya que esto puede agotar los aceites naturales del cuero cabelludo. Es recomendable establecer una rutina de lavado de un día sí y un día no para permitir que el cuero cabelludo respire y recupere su equilibrio.
No seguir una rutina regular
La inconsistencia en el cuidado capilar es otro error habitual. Muchas personas solo cuidan su cabello de vez en cuando o se rinden al no ver resultados inmediatos. La clave para lograr un cabello saludable es ser persistente y seguir una rutina regular, ya que los resultados requieren tiempo y dedicación.
Aplicar champú en toda la melena
Otro error es aplicar el champú en toda la longitud del cabello. En realidad, debe aplicarse principalmente en la parte superior del cuero cabelludo, donde se acumulan la grasa y la suciedad. Concentrarse en esta área asegura una limpieza efectiva sin dañar el resto de la melena.
Realizar un único lavado
Por último, es importante destacar que realizar un solo lavado no es suficiente para limpiar adecuadamente el cabello. Es aconsejable un doble lavado en cada ducha para eliminar residuos y mejorar la eficacia del tratamiento capilar.
Este método elimina la caspa y el exceso de grasa, y prepara el cabello para recibir los beneficios de otros productos de cuidado.
¡Cuida tu cabello!
Cuidar nuestro cabello no tiene que ser una tarea complicada. Identificar y corregir estos errores comunes en nuestra rutina de lavado puede marcar una gran diferencia en la salud y apariencia de nuestro cabello.
Con estos consejos, es posible lograr una melena radiante y saludable, lo que sin duda impactará positivamente en nuestro bienestar general. Recuerda que un cabello bien cuidado es un reflejo de nuestra salud y autoestima.

author: @englishjagrannews
title: Weather Update: Red Alert For Dense Fog In Delhi; Several Trains Cancelled, Flights Delayed
text: - By [Vivek Raj](https://english.jagran.com/authors/vivek-raj) - Published: Fri, 29 Dec 2023 07:49 AM (IST) - Source:ANI A red alert has been sounded in Delhi for Friday, along with an orange alert for December 30 and a yellow alert for the year-end and New Year's Eve, as per the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD). The region, along with North India, is grappling with mist and dense fog, disrupting travel and causing accidents. The widespread fog has resulted in transportation challenges, affecting both train and air travel. On Thursday, low visibility impacted railway services, resulting in delays for 22 Delhi-bound trains. — ANI (@ANI) [#WATCH]| Delhi: Some trains delayed due to fog and low visibility in the national capital; Visuals from New Delhi Railway Station (Visuals shot at 7.20 am) [pic.twitter.com/fPksNt8oEM] [December 29, 2023] At the Delhi airport, 134 flights, encompassing both domestic and international routes, faced delays on the previous day. Among them, 35 international departures and 28 international arrivals were affected, along with 43 domestic departures and 28 domestic arrivals. — ANI (@ANI) [#WATCH]| Delhi: Few flights delayed due to fog and low visibility in the national capital; Visuals from Indira Gandhi International Airport [pic.twitter.com/mlCrrZ7QlT] [December 29, 2023] The latest INSAT imagery from the Meteorological Department revealed a dense fog layer covering northern regions of India, including Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, and northwest Madhya Pradesh. [Also ReadAyodhya Ram Mandir: Voting On Lord Ram Lalla's Idol Today, Temple Trust To Select Best Among Three ](https://english.jagran.com/india/ayodhya-ram-mandir-voting-on-lord-ram-lallas-idol-on-december-29-trust-to-select-best-of-three-10123551) ALSO READ: [After Colorado, Maine Declares Donald Trump Ineligible For Presidential Ballot](https://english.jagran.com/india/after-colorado-maine-declares-donald-trump-ineligible-for-presidential-ballot-10123543) The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) extended its warning, projecting dense fog over Haryana and Punjab for the next five days. Uttar Pradesh is expected to experience similar conditions for the next three days, prompting the UP State Road Transport Corporation to issue guidelines for bus operations during periods of low visibility. IMD has issued a warning of dense fog persisting until December 31, with visibility ranging from 199 meters to 50 meters or even less. The meteorological department attributes the foggy conditions to an active Western Disturbance, predicting a partly cloudy sky on Friday. [Also ReadMortal Remains Of Vijayakanth Brought To Island Ground In Chennai, Thousands Gather To Pay Their Last Respects](https://english.jagran.com/india/vijayakanth-death-news-updates-dmdk-leader-mortal-remains-island-ground-chennai-tamil-nadu-last-respects-10123550) Thursday marked the coldest day of the season in Delhi, with the maximum temperature recorded at 21.4 degrees Celsius, the lowest of the season. UP CM Yogi Adityanath had to postpone his Ayodhya visit due to the adverse weather conditions. In response to the adverse weather, schools in Noida and Greater Noida are closed on December 29 and 30 for all classes. In Mathura, schools for classes one to eight will open at 10 am and close at 3 pm. Most districts in Haryana and Punjab experienced a day without sunshine. ALSO READ: [Senior IPS Officer Nina Singh Appointed Chief Of CISF; Anish Dayal Singh To Head CRPF](https://english.jagran.com/india/senior-ips-officer-nina-singh-appointed-director-general-of-cisf-anish-dayal-to-head-crpf-10123528) The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) reported Delhi's 24-hour average Air Quality Index (AQI) at 358 on Thursday. This follows an earlier reading of 445 on Saturday morning, with specific areas like Jahangirpuri, Anand Vihar, and Bawana witnessing deplorable air quality conditions. The prevailing AQI categorizes Delhi's air quality as "very poor" and "severe," highlighting the persistent challenge of pollution in the region.
